snippet: President Obama met with a new group called Organizing for Action, which he hopes will push his agenda but which critics say is an avenue to sell special access to the president.
abstract: Pres Obama meets with new independent lobbying group called Organizing for Action, which he hopes will push his agenda but which critics say is avenue to sell special access to president.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

lead_paragraph: President Obama met with a new group called Organizing for Action, which he hopes will push his agenda but which critics say is an avenue to sell special access to the president.

headline.seo: Obama Rallies Supporters to Support His Agenda
headline.main: Obama Rallies Supporters and Donors to Keep His Campaign Agenda Alive
headline.print_headline: Obama Rallies Supporters and Donors to Keep His Campaign Agenda Alive
